intro: Staehelina elegans, commonly known as the elegant starflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Staehelina elegans is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
